scenarioDescription:
The HD 205739 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 205739 is a star with 1.22 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.33 times its radius. It is located 301.72 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 2.84 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 205739 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 205739 system


HD 205739 b

HD 205739 b was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory observatory, in 2008-11, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.90 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 205739 b is 435.660 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 205739 b is 13.600 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 205739 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 205739, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory.
name: HD 205739 - System With 1 Exoplanet
